meanings.definition: To be excessively cautious or careful.
meanings.sent1: She was overcautioning about crossing the street, looking left and right multiple times.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcaution when it comes to trying new foods.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was overcautioning before jumping from one tree to another, as if it had never done it before.
meanings.sent4: The detective was overcautioning his every move, afraid of making a wrong step in the investigation.
meanings.sent5: The child was overcautioning with his toys, making sure they were perfectly lined up before playing.

meanings.definition: The act of being overly cautious.
meanings.sent1: Her overcautioning often leads to delays in making decisions.
meanings.sent2: The overcautioning of the hiker prevented any accidents during the trek.
meanings.sent3: The overcautioning of the cat made it take hours to finally approach the new toy.
meanings.sent4: The overcautioning of the driver caused frustration among other drivers on the road.
meanings.sent5: The overcautioning of the teacher made the students feel safe and secure in the classroom.
